title.narrative: Addressing Immediate Needs of the GBV Survivors Among Internally Displaced Population, Through Life-Saving Multi-sectorial Services in Kandahar, Hilmand, and Baghlan Provinces

description.narrative: Afghan Planning Agency and Organization for Research and Community Development intend to implement life-saving multi-sectorial GBV services to IDP, returnees and a percentage of local community in Kandahar, Hilmand, and Baghlan provinces through a joint collaboration. Through this project, special attention will be paid to vulnerable groups, such as women and girls through the following activities: 1. The project will be implemented in Hilmand (including Lashkarga and Greshk districts), Kandahar (including Arghandab, Punjwai and Zherai districts) and Baghlan (including Baghlan-e-Markazi, Doshi, Puli Khumri districts) provinces. 2. Establish three Women Friendly Health Spaces (WFHSs) in each province, two by APA Kandahar and Hilmand and one by ORCD in Baghlan. 3. APA and ORCD will establish 3 mobile teams, one team per province, which will provide mobile psycho-social support/counseling services to women and girls who do not have access to Women Friendly Health Spaces. The IDPs’ locations for the mobile health teams will be selected in coordination with the Directorate of Refugees and Repatriation and UNHCR through collaboration and monthly IDP screening meetings. In each team, there will be two/three trained psychosocial counselor (1 male amp1 female) and 2 community mobilizer (male and female). Community mobilizers will mobilize the community through community-wide meetings with elders/shuras/CDCs in Community Centers and Masjids. They will orient communities on project activities and the need for mobile teams. In close coordination and consultation with community elders, the sites for mobile teams will be selected based on the majority populated areas of peoples of concern, IDPs and returnees. a. Mobile teams will provide services to IDPs 6 days/week each team will provide psychosocial counseling to at least 25 IDPs/week. The counseling will be for groups and individuals. Additional to psychosocial counseling, the mobile team will refer to GBV survivors to WFHSs and will provide other services like advanced mental health, medical care, legal and justice in coordination with Directorates of Women Affairs (DoWAs) and AIHRC. All clients who receive services will be registered in a manner that their contact details are recorded for remote monitoring purposes and will be provided with referral cards. GBV survivors will be recorded by survivor consent. 4. Provide a comprehensive psychosocial support and counseling to IDPs, women and girls through WFHSs by trained psychosocial counselors. 5. Establish a mechanism for referring GBV survivors to provide case-specific advanced level of services to other sectors, like medical care, mental health, legal and justice services, police and safe houses. 6. APA and ORCD will implement the GBV awareness-raising activities to IDP communities. This will comprise campaign, posters, open debates, discussions and success story sharing. The community mobilizers will play an important role in implementing GBV awareness activities. Through these activities, women, girls and men will be sensitized on GBV advocacy, prevent, referral points, protection, and women and human rights. These awareness sessions will be organized in separate groups for women and men. In each group, 15-20 people will have participation. These sessions will be interactive for participations. IEC materials developed by UNFPA, DoWA, MoPH, IMC, APA and ORCD will be distributed and used under this activity. Additionally, basic hygiene education sessions will provide another opportunity to implement GBV awareness-raising activities. 7. Implement appropriate Basic Life Skills training, as a community entry point, to build trust on reporting and seek GBV support from the Women Friendly Health Spaces. 8. Provide dignity/hygiene kits to women and girls of reproductive age, along with basic hygiene education. Basic hygiene kits will also be provided male beneficiaries. 9.
